pullrequest.title: Improve console output, fix for issue #794

content.raw:
I have narrowed down the issue by adding some tests to UNIT_Console_TEST in 1878672 (branch console_improvements_scpeters). There appear to be two problems:

1. gzlog messages with `\n` characters don't get flushed to the log file until a `std::endl` is received.

2. Whenever an `std::endl` is received by `gzerr`, `gzwarn`, `gzmsg`, or `gzdbg`, no other messages can be sent to that stream.
content.html:
I have narrowed down the issue by adding some tests to UNIT_Console_TEST in 1878672 (branch console_improvements_scpeters). There appear to be two problems:

  1. gzlog messages with \n characters don't get flushed to the log file until a std::endl is received.

  2. Whenever an std::endl is received by gzerr, gzwarn, gzmsg, or gzdbg, no other messages can be sent to that stream.
